text:
If you liked the movie Ocean's Eleven, or are otherwise interested in high stakes robberies - you might enjoy the report below: _The Perfect Heist: Recipes from Around the World_ by Lafleur, Purvis, Roesler, and Westland.
This is an actual, academic look at the methods and characteristics of "high-value heists of cash, gold, gems, artwork, and other valuables" which was done by some of my coworkers when I worked at Sandia National Labs. While a few of the thefts are "only" a million dollars or so, the largest one examined was the Millennium Dome Raid - which was a staggering $849 million in today's dollars!
<https://www.osti.gov/servlets/purl/1154957>

elements.text: If you liked the movie Ocean's Eleven, or are otherwise interested in high stakes robberies - you might enjoy the report below:
The Perfect Heist: Recipes from Around the World

by Lafleur, Purvis, Roesler, and Westland.
This is an actual, academic look at the methods and characteristics of "high-value heists of cash, gold, gems, artwork, and other valuables" which was done by some of my coworkers when I worked at Sandia National Labs. While a few of the thefts are "only" a million dollars or so, the largest one examined was the Millennium Dome Raid - which was a staggering $849 million in today's dollars!
